description:
When Daichi Manatsu sees a mysterious rainbow appearing near the Tanegashima Space Center, he immediately recognizes it as being similar to an apparition that formed when his father was killed in a mysterious accident years earlier. Traveling to Tanegashima, Daichi quickly finds himself involved with the machinations of Globe, a secret agency created to defend mankind from extraterrestrial forces. And while it might seem like a big job for a mere teenager, it turns out that the skills Daichi has honed on video games, combined with a special weapon called the Livlaster, make Daichi ideally suited for operating the Earth Engine Impacter, a giant robot that may be Mankind's best hope against aliens whose goal is to completely drain our world's lifeforce energy. Fortunately, Daichi won't be on his own, as he's quickly joined by a group of equally dedicated young people who all have their own skills and abilities to contribute to the battle.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/igarashi_takuya)

Formerly part of [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Currently freelance with ties to studio [Bones](https://anilist.co/studio/4/).

**Birthplace:** Shiga Prefecture, Japan
**Graduated:** Kyoto College of Arts (now known as Kyoto University of Art and Design)

**Youji Enokido** is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer. He has been friends with director [Ikuhara Kunihiko](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara) since high school.
[Blog](http://bb9.blog.shinobi.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minato_fumi) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=4510) | [Tinami](http://www.tinami.com/creator/profile/23687)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/imozuka) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E7%9F%B3%E9%87%8E%E8%81%A1)

Satoshi Ishino is a Japanese animator, animation supervisor, character/mechanical designer and animation director.

He started working at Studio Giants, but later went to work at Studio Fantasia before becoming a freelance animator. Today he is a part of the animator group Studio Hercules (スタジオへらくれす), and he's also a part of the doujin circle TEAM Imozuka (TEAM いもずか).

Satoshi is best known for his work as a character designer and animation supervisor in the show Excel Saga and the related Puni Puni Poemi.

__Doujin Circles:__ UB, Vachicalist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/okamarble)

A guy who chooses to only play female characters in games. Since he is called Okama (cross-dresser) after all.

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

Flumpool is a Japanese rock band of four from Osaka. The name is a compound word of f from the English word four, since there are 4 members, along with the word meaning mass, lump, and the word pool. Flumpool falls under the label of A-Sketch.

Yamamura has been writing the lyrics for almost all of their songs and Sakai has been doing the composing.

Members:
• Ryuta Yamamura (山村 隆太) - vocals, guitar
• Kazuki Sakai (阪井 一生) - guitar
• Genki Amakawa (尼川 元気) - bass
• Seiji Ogura (小倉 誠司) - drums

(Source: MAL)

Originating from [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/).

_Note: Not to be confused with either the [Duel Masters character designer](https://anilist.co/staff/185645/) or the [studio coordinator](https://anilist.co/staff/172956/)._
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). Aspired to work in the industry after having seen [Laputa: Castle in the Sky](https://anilist.co/anime/513/).
Directs on occasions.

Directs on occasions.

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/isao__hayashi)

Originating from [Nakamura Production](https://anilist.co/studio/6658/Nakamura-Production). Affiliated with [Cloverworks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Rx6w9YmxY0zly5A)

Originally an animator.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E8%8B%A5%E6%9E%97%E5%92%8C%E5%BC%98)

**Kazuhiro Wakabayashi** is a Japanese sound director who was formerly affiliated with Techno Sound and Omnibus Promotion. After going freelance, he established his own sound production studio on May 7, 2004 called Fonishia. In 2013, he went freelance once again after his sound production studio disbanded.
**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Tia_ct)**

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/snjaramaki) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/荒牧伸志) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shinji_Aramaki)

Aramaki is one of the leading figures in the industry's CG animation, and is noted for his various design works in numerous anime series such as [Gasaraki](https://anilist.co/anime/782/), [Witch Hunter Robin](https://anilist.co/anime/7/), [Wolf's Rain](https://anilist.co/anime/202/) and [Soul Eater](https://anilist.co/anime/3588/) among many others.

Influenced by [Space Battleship Yamato](https://anilist.co/anime/1650/), [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/), and Star Wars during his junior and senior high school years, he decided to pursue a career in film. One of his first representative works was an independently produced animation titled "Moonstruck Artemis," that he made while part of a manga club during his university days. Aramaki didn't have a special desire to work in the animation industry, but has stated joining it solely because he could draw and the industry had a wide range of options for someone like that. He has also said that the spread of digital technology has made it easier for him to work in both anime and live-action.

In 2004, Aramaki directed [Appleseed](https://anilist.co/anime/54/), a re-interpretation of a [Shirou Masamune](https://anilist.co/staff/97609/) manga by [the same name](https://anilist.co/manga/30668/). Although bashed by critics, the movie was an influential piece in the medium that had great impact on creators around the world. Studio Ghibli co-founder [Toshio Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101638/) said the movie would reform the industry.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/546134514)

Representative director of REAL-T.
[Website](http://www.yanase.works/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yanase_t)
